page.title: 05The Purton Magazine
page.content: The Purton Magazine was the idea of the local vicar who saw the need for a community publication. The magazine is distributed to subscribers by a network of volunteers. The magazine costs twelve pence and is financed from advertisements by local traders and through subscriptions. It is a good example of a publication which provides information and a point of contact for people living in the country districts. The content is extensive and varied. There is a "What's on in Purton" feature where monthly meetings and activities are listed. An unusual feature is "Purton Personality", a sketch of a local character whose identity is revealed in the next issue.
